conclusion: The problem is about an AC generator and requires finding the maximum electromotive force (EMF) generated.
An AC generator works on electromagnetic induction, inducing EMF proportional to the rate of change of magnetic flux.
The general equation for induced EMF in a coil rotating in a uniform magnetic field is given.
The magnetic flux through the coil varies sinusoidally with time.
The magnetic flux can be expressed as a sine function of time.
At t=0, the coil is parallel to the magnetic field, meaning magnetic flux is maximum.
From the graph, the maximum flux is 2.0 x 10^-2 Wb, and the period T is approximately 6.28 x 10^-2 s.
Calculate angular frequency ω using the period T.
Calculate the induced EMF using the formula ε = -N dΦ/dt.
The maximum value of the induced EMF occurs when cos(ωt) = 1.
Double-check the units to ensure correctness.
EMF is in volts, calculated as ε_max = N Φ_0 ω.
Alternatively, use Faraday's law stating induced EMF is equal to the negative rate of change of magnetic flux.
Given Φ = Φ_0 sin(ωt), calculate dΦ/dt = Φ_0 ω cos(ωt).
The maximum value of ε is Φ_0 ω.
